comments.author: rich@rwapservices.co.uk
comments.text: User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20110706 Firefox/5.0 SeaMonkey/2.2 Build ID: 20110706120824 Steps to reproduce: The tradedoubler affiliate program uses off links to its advertisers, such as: http://clkuk.tradedoubler.com/click?p(48122)a(882967)g(16422090) I created a simple text link on my HTML page with this as the text link Actual results: The line becomes: text link When the page is made live - the link then fails, saying it is an invalid link. Expected results: Should have clicked through to UK2.net
comments.raw_text: User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:5.0) Gecko/20110706 Firefox/5.0 SeaMonkey/2.2 Build ID: 20110706120824 Steps to reproduce: The tradedoubler affiliate program uses off links to its advertisers, such as: http://clkuk.tradedoubler.com/click?p(48122)a(882967)g(16422090) I created a simple text link on my HTML page with this as the text link Actual results: The line becomes: text link When the page is made live - the link then fails, saying it is an invalid link. Expected results: Should have clicked through to UK2.net

comments.creator: pppx@i.com.ua
comments.text: Is this still reproducible? When I click on saved link, it tells now "This link is not active, please inform the webmaster." so link is fine.
comments.author: pppx@i.com.ua
comments.raw_text: Is this still reproducible? When I click on saved link, it tells now "This link is not active, please inform the webmaster." so link is fine.

Yes - the error is still reproducible.

The whole point is that the link should be to 
http://clkuk.tradedoubler.com/click?p(48122)a(882967)g(16422090)

THAT LINK WORKS CORRECTLY TO TAKE IT THROUGH TO UK2.NET

However, when editing the link in Composer, the brackets get escaped, so the link becomes:
http://clkuk.tradedoubler.com/click?p%2848122%29a%28882967%29g%2816422090%29

THAT LINK DOES NOT WORK - IT IS AN INVALID LINK
comments.creator: rich@rwapservices.co.uk
comments.author: rich@rwapservices.co.uk
